Row.Text: Great Council
High Elder
Our people are now drinking from the skulls of their enemies and graffiting over our cities. I worry the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.
Become King of the Alans

Together with our powerful brothers, the Alani, we have tamed this ferocious land in spite of our many enemies. Now we must assert our dominance over them, so that they may know their father's name: Genseric, leader of the Vandals, and King of the Alans.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be the Vandals [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must own at least three cities [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Culture} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 {2_ResourceType} [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Empire becomes known as the Vandals and Alans [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Mounted Units may capture defeated enemies [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Gain 2 free [ICON_RES_HORSE] Horses

Together with our powerful brothers, the Alani, we have tamed this ferocious land in spite of our many enemies. Now we must assert our dominance over them, so that they may know their father's name: Genseric, leader of the Vandals, and King of the Alans.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Empire becomes known as the Vandals and Alans [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Mounted Units may capture defeated enemies [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Gain 2 free [ICON_RES_HORSE] Horses
Vandalic and Alani
Vandalic and Alani Empire
The Vandals and Alans
Genseric of the Vandals has become King of the Alans.
Alani Tribe
May capture defeated enemies.
Impose Religious Taxes

Amongst our conquered possessions are those who would refuse to practice our beliefs. Instead of flailing and executing them as they might better deserve, let us instead tax them for what they are worth.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be the Vandals [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have captured at least one capital [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each World Religion that has at least 1 follower in all cities.

Amongst our conquered possessions are those who would refuse to practice our beliefs. Instead of flailing and executing them as they might better deserve, let us instead tax them for what they are worth.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each World Religion that has at least 1 follower in all cities.
JFD: Vandal Taxes
+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each World Religion that has at least 1 follower
St. Augustine
As we lay siege to the city of {1_CityName}, we have been asked by our foes to offer reprieve to an important religious leader, St. Augustine, who is trapped amidst our assault.[NEWLINE]
If they value his life, they will surrender the city!
We shall spare his life then, and see to it that he leaves the city unharmed.
He shall make a fine ransom. We must not harm him.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Lose {1_Num} [ICON_PEACE] Faith[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]50% chance {2_CityName} will immediately surrender with no warmonger penalty[ENDCOLOR]
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_CityName} heals 20 damage[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gain {2_Num} [ICON_PEACE] Faith[ENDCOLOR]
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_CityName} heals 10 damage[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gain {2_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[ENDCOLOR]
Our enemy did not surrender to spare the life of St. Augustine of {1_CityName}, and so our assault continues.
To spare the life of St. Augustine of {1_CityName}, our enemy has surrendered.
We have halted our assault on {1_CityName} so that St. Augustine might flee the siege.
We have halted our assault on {1_CityName} so that St. Augustine could be captured for ransom.
{1_LeaderName} of {2_CivName} has slain St. Augustine of {3_CityName} in his besiegement of the city.
{1_LeaderName} of {2_CivName} has allowed St. Augustine of {3_CityName} to flee his besiegement of the city unharmed.
{1_LeaderName} of {2_CivName} has ransomed the life of St. Augustine of {3_CityName} in his besiegement of the city.
The Arian Heresy

Ulfilas, a Gothic missionary from the east, has come to appeal to us the case of the heretic Arius. The teachings of Arius, known as Arianism, have been declared heretical by many of the religious empires in the world, but Ulfilas has appealed to us to defend them instead.[NEWLINE]
Execute this heretic.
We shall accept these teachings, and defend them as our own.
Religion? Bah. Ask this priest how much his life is worth.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gain {1_Num} {2_Yield}[ENDCOLOR]
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]All cities adopt Arianism. If Arianism has not been founded, it will be founded in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital with randomly chosen beliefs.[ENDCOLOR]
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gain {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[ENDCOLOR]
We have had the heretic Ulfilas put to death.
We have accepted the teachings of Arius.
We have extorted as much gold as we could from Ulfilas the missionary.
A missionary preaching the heretic teachings of Arius has been executed by {1_LeaderName} of {2_CivName}.
{1_LeaderName} of {2_CivName} has embraced the teachings of the heretic Arius.
Eudocia
